version.description: The version of the repository, or "independent" for a repository with independently versioned packages.

packages.description: An array of globs where packages can be located.

useNx.description: By setting `useNx` to `false` you can use the legacy task running implementations in `lerna` (`p-map` and `p-queue`) instead of using the default modern task runner implementation powered by [Nx](https://nx.dev).

npmClient.description: The npm client to use when running commands (either npm, yarn, or pnpm). Defaults to npm if unspecified.

npmClientArgs.description: Arguments to pass to the npm client when running commands.

loglevel.description: The level of logging to use when running commands. Defaults to info if unspecified.

concurrency.description: The number of concurrent processes to use when running commands. Defaults to the number of CPUs if unspecified.

rejectCycles.description: When true, Lerna will fail if a cycle is detected among dependencies.

progress.description: When true, Lerna will display progress bars when running commands. Progress bars are always off in CI.

sort.description: When true, Lerna will sort the packages topologically (dependencies before dependents).

maxBuffer.description: The maximum number of bytes to allow a child process for subcommand execution.

yes.description: When true, Lerna will automatically answer yes to all confirmation prompts.

scope.description: Include only packages with names matching the given glob

ignore.description: Exclude packages with names matching the given glob

private.description: Include private packages in the command. During `lerna create`, specifies that the new package is private (never published to any external registry).

since.description: Only include packages that have been changed since the specified [ref].

excludeDependents.description: Exclude all transitive dependents when running a command with --since, overriding the default "changed" algorithm.

includeDependents.description: Include all transitive dependents when running a command regardless of --scope, --ignore, or --since.

includeDependencies.description: Include all transitive dependencies when running a command regardless of --scope, --ignore, or --since.

includeMergedTags.description: Include tags from merged branches when running a command with --since.

continueIfNoMatch.description: Don't fail if no package is matched.

summaryFile.description: Generate a json summary report after all packages have been successfully published, you can pass an optional path for where to save the file.

dev.description: During `lerna add`, save the newly added package to devDependencies instead of dependencies.

peer.description: During `lerna add`, save the newly added package to peerDependencies instead of dependencies.

noBootstrap.description: Do not automatically chain `lerna bootstrap` after `lerna add`.

hoist.description: During `lerna bootstrap`, install external dependencies matching [glob] to the repo root.

nohoist.description: During `lerna bootstrap`, don't hoist external dependencies matching [glob] to the repo root.

strict.description: During `lerna bootstrap`, don't allow warnings when hoisting as it causes longer bootstrap times and other issues.

useWorkspaces.description: During `lerna bootstrap`, enable integration with Yarn workspaces.

access.description: During `lerna create` and when using a scope, set publishConfig.access value.

bin.description: During `lerna create`, specifies that the new package has an executable with the given name.

description.description: During `lerna create`, specifies the description of the new package.

dependencies.description: During `lerna create`, specifies the list of dependencies of the new package.

esModule.description: During `lerna create`, when true, initializes a transpiled ES Module.

homepage.description: During `lerna create`, specifies the homepage of the new package. Defaults to a subpath of the root pkg.homepage.

keywords.description: During `lerna create`, specifies the list of keywords of the new package.

license.description: During `lerna create`, specifies the license of the new package (SPDX identifier). Defaults to ISC.

tag.description: During `lerna create`, specifies the publishConfig.tag for the new package.

flatten.description: During `lerna import`, when true, import each merge commit as a single change the merge introduced.

dest.description: During `lerna import`, specifies the directory for the external git repository.

preserveCommit.description: During `lerna import`, when true, preserve the original committer in additional to original author.

independent.description: During `lerna init`, when true, version packages independently.

canary.description: During `lerna publish`, when true, publish packages after every successful merge using the sha as part of the tag.

distTag.description: During `lerna publish`, publish packages with the specified npm dist-tag.

preDistTag.description: During `lerna publish`, publish prerelease packages with the specified npm dist-tag.

legacyAuth.description: For `lerna publish`, the Legacy Base64 Encoded username and password to use.

gitHead.description: For `lerna publish`, the explicit SHA to set as gitHead when packing tarballs, only allowed with 'from-package' positional.

graphType.description: DEPRECATED: For `lerna publish`, if you want to ignore devDependencies when considering the package graph you can set this property equal to 'dependencies'. This will be removed in v6 of lerna.

otp.description: During `lerna publish`, supply a one-time password for publishing with two-factor authentication.

requireScripts.description: During `lerna publish`, when true, execute ./scripts/prepublish.js and ./scripts/postpublish.js, relative to package root.

noGitReset.description: During `lerna publish`, when true, do not reset changes to working tree after publishing is complete.

gitReset.description: During `lerna publish`, when true, reset changes to working tree after publishing is complete.

tempTag.description: During `lerna publish`, when true, create a temporary tag while publishing.

noVerifyAccess.description: During `lerna publish`, when true, do not verify package read-write access for current npm user.

verifyAccess.description: During `lerna publish`, when true, verify package read-write access for current npm user.

skipNxCache.description: During `lerna run`, when true, skip the nx cache.

loadEnvFiles.description: During `lerna run`, when false, skip loading of environment variables from .env files.

allowBranch.description: For `lerna version`, the branches to allow versioning from.

amend.description: During `lerna version`, when true, amend the existing commit instead of generating a new one.

conventionalPrerelease.description: During `lerna version`, version changed packages as prereleases when using --conventional-commits.

conventionalBumpPrerelease.description: During `lerna version`, bumps version of changed prereleased packages when using --conventional-commits.

changelogPreset.description: For `lerna version`, the custom conventional-changelog preset.

gitRemote.description: During `lerna version`, push git changes to the specified remote.

createRelease.description: During `lerna version`, an official GitHub or GitLab release for every version.

message.description: For `lerna version`, the custom commit message to use when creating the version commit.

noChangelog.description: During `lerna version`, when true, do not generate CHANGELOG.md files when using --conventional-commits.

changelog.description: During `lerna version`, when true, generate CHANGELOG.md files when using --conventional-commits.

noCommitHooks.description: During `lerna version`, when true, do not run git commit hooks when committing version changes.

commitHooks.description: During `lerna version`, when true, run git commit hooks when committing version changes.

noGitTagVersion.description: During `lerna version`, when true, do not commit or tag version changes.

gitTagVersion.description: During `lerna version`, when true, commit and tag version changes.

noPush.description: During `lerna version`, when true, do not push tagged commit to git remote.

push.description: During `lerna version`, when true, push tagged commit to git remote.

signGitCommit.description: During `lerna version`, when true, pass the `--gpg-sign` flag to `git commit`.

signGitTag.description: During `lerna version`, when true, pass the `--sign` flag to `git tag`.

forceGitTag.description: During `lerna version`, when true, pass the `--force` flag to `git tag`.

tagVersionPrefix.description: During `lerna version`, customize the tag prefix. To remove entirely, pass an empty string.

registry.description: The npm registry to use for all npm client operations. During `lerna create`, specifies the new package's publishConfig.registry.

conventionalCommits.description: During `lerna version`, `lerna changed`, and `lerna publish`, when true, use conventional commits specification to determine the version bump and generate CHANGELOG.md files.

conventionalGraduate.description: Detect currently prereleased packages that would change to a non-prerelease version. Relevant for `lerna changed` and `lerna version`.

forceLocal.description: During `lerna bootstrap` and `lerna link`, when true, force local sibling links regardless of version range match.

contents.description: For `lerna bootstrap`, `lerna link`, and `lerna publish`, the subdirectory to use as the source of any links. Must apply to ALL packages.

ignoreChanges.description: Ignore changes in files matched by glob(s) when detecting changed packages. Relevant for `lerna changed`, `lerna publish`, `lerna version`, and `lerna diff`.

stream.description: During `lerna exec` and `lerna run`, stream output with lines prefixed by originating package name.

parallel.description: During `lerna exec` and `lerna run`, run commands with unlimited concurrency, streaming prefixed output.

noBail.description: During `lerna exec` and `lerna run`, when true, do not exit with non-zero status if a command fails.

bail.description: During `lerna exec` and `lerna run`, exit with non-zero status if any command fails.

noPrefix.description: During `lerna exec` and `lerna run`, when true, do not prefix output with originating package name.

prefix.description: During `lerna exec` and `lerna run`, prefix output with originating package name.

profile.description: During `lerna exec` and `lerna run`, profile command execution and output performance profile to default location.

profileLocation.description: During `lerna exec` and `lerna run`, profile command execution and output performance profile to the specified location instead of default project root.

preid.description: For `lerna publish` and `lerna version`, the prerelease identifier when versioning a prerelease.

ignoreScripts.description: During `lerna bootstrap`, `lerna publish`, and `lerna version`, don't run ANY lifecycle scripts in bootstrapped packages.

noGranularPathspec.description: During `lerna publish` and `lerna version`, when true, do not reset changes file-by-file, but globally.

granularPathspec.description: During `lerna publish` and `lerna version`, when true, reset changes file-by-file, not globally.

forcePublish.description: During `lerna changed` and `lerna version`, always include targeted packages when detecting changed packages, skipping default logic.

exact.description: During `lerna add`, save the exact version of the newly added package. During `lerna version`, specify cross-dependency version numbers exactly rather than with a caret (^).

ignorePrepublish.description: During `lerna publish` and `lerna bootstrap`, when true, disable deprecated 'prepublish' lifecycle script.

verbose.description: When true, escalates loglevel to 'verbose' and shows nx verbose output if useNx is true.
